element.name: Grave Misgivings by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/3)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.long-description:
Start from Tibradden car park (N53 14.567 W006 17.684) Follow the track and trail upwards to N 53 14.320 W 006 16.824, which is the location of the grave referre to in the cache name. Remains and Bronze-age vessel were found here in 1849, and a "passage grave" erected on the spot. Whether the new edifice was built on the site of an older grave is not known, hence the misgivings in the cache name.
Whatever the date of the earliest tomb on Tibradden, genuine passage graves from the 3rd millenium BC stand on several adjacent mountain tops - Newgrange can be seen on a clear day (the bearing is just over the Papal Cross in the Phoenix Park). The cache is just South of East when viewed from the centre of the grave.
The cache is not hidden in the passage grave - please do not disturb the stones in the vicinity of the grave!
element.encoded-hints: Under a boulder, covered with rocks

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by slands
Took a "wong turn" on the way up, and ended up having to scramble over some very rough ground and up some rocks. Should have followed the yellow man [:)]
As a result of the wrong turn, and the now very wet weather I arrived at the grave soaked to the skin, and with very little time - my car was in the car park which was due to close at 5pm, and I was not sure how long it would take me to walk back down the "proper" path.
Had a look at the grave, and then had a quick look for the cache, but I could barely see with the driving rain on my glasses, so decided to abandon the search and come back another day.
Even though I did not find it, and despite the weather, I enjoyed the walk, so will definitely be back soon to find it.
Stephen....

2010-06-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by colmyster
Found this one on my day off. Took a shortcut through the forest which is not recommended. Lovely spot and nice cache with loads of stuff.
In: electric yo yo Out: Arthur C. Clarke novel (hadn't read this one, thanks a million)

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by polorein
Found on D-Day in ammo box with AB beautiful location, what a pity the burial site is left like this can the department of the environment not take better care of these historical sites.

2010-05-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by annalivia
We entered Tibradden wood through an alternative entrance near the Oasis Cache (didnt find that) - hence the 45 minute trek to the top! Worth it for the views alone! We saw 5 bouncing deer - awesome!! Great Cache- thanks Hezekiah!

2010-03-22T19:00:00Z : Found it by Bootle
Great spot, well worthy of a visit from any cacher who has not yet done so. I walked up from Mossy and LOVED the trek. The new mountain path is great. Along the way I saw seven deer in a group who were startled to see me approaching. Afterwards I enjoyed the great views of Dublin, Three Rock and down into Wicklow. I'd love to come back and do more of this walk. TFTC!

wpt.name: GCRRAY
wpt.desc: Grave Misgivings by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/3)
